vehiclesimulationcore
Class World

java.lang.Object
  vehiclesimulationcore.World
public class World
extends java.lang.Object

Title: Vehicle Dynamics Simulation Program

Description: vehicle dynmaics, braking system simulation

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2006 Faculty of Information Technology Engineering at Damascus University

World is the class that holds the VirtualUniverse and takes care of collaborating all other geometry classes with independence of the program UI.

for now we set members as static to enable access from anywhere without referencing besides it's easier, the simulation requires no more than one world

Constructor Detail

World

public World()
during construction we create the canvas, the universe, create the scence graph and compile it.

creation of single components of the scene graph is done once, and put as static members for now.

each branch group is compiled alone

Method Detail

createSceneGraph

javax.media.j3d.BranchGroup createSceneGraph()
set capabilities for the scene graph to allow removal and adding objects at runtime this is set to enable switching the viewing cababitlies without recompiling, which might yields a little performance to switch speed.

single objects are added under separate brabch groups to enable detaching from the main scene graph, to enable the switching, and seprate compiling at the end. *

updateWorld

public static void updateWorld()
empty for the moment

switchGrid

public static void switchGrid()
use this to update the world when adding or removing the grid from the scene graph from external classes

this method switches between adding or removing the Grid

switchTerrain

public static void switchTerrain()
use this to update the world when adding or removing the terrain from the scene graph from external classes

this method switches between adding or removing the terrain

switchTexture

public static void switchTexture()
enabling and disabling the texture is a little bit different, since textures are loaded by the loader we need to reload the relating objects and free old ones, how ever since we did the whole capabilty thing to speed up switching, so we load two objects for each file one with textures and another without or with less details for fast performace switch since speed is far more concern than memory. so for the vehicle the second object is one without textures and with less level of detail

switchVehicle

public static void switchVehicle()
switch the vehicle between two modes: full options and one with less level of details here we provide two models for the vehicle and it's wheels, one with transparent windows two sided materails, acceptable wheels.

the other model optimizes the wheels, no transparancy, no two sided materials, so when performance degrades switching to such a model will be helpful

getCurVehicle

public static VehicleGeom getCurVehicle()
the current selected vehicle geomerty to get viewed depending on the switch choosen between the full-optimized models

Returns:
VehicleGeom

switch light1: directional light from a bove

switchLight2

switch light3: directional light,coming from the side headinf towarsd positive z
